fact: In Book VI of the Odyssey, Homer places the cave of Polyphemus, the Cyclops who imprisons Ulysses and his men, on the slopes of Etna. Polyphemus, after being blinded, tries to kill Ulysses and his crew by throwing boulders at them. These boulders can be seen in the sea in front of the village of Aci Trezza and are now called "Faraglioni".
